name: Key recovery from memory
description: This describes the technique whereby an attempt is made to extract key material from memory, or a memory acquisition of a running system to fascinate the decryption of some data
examples: Bulk Extractor - of the many scanners within bulk extractor, one of which attempts to locate AES keys.
Volatility - the plug in ‘trucryptmaster’ attempts to recover Truecrypt 7.1a master keys.
references: Hargreaves, C. and Chivers, H., 2008, March. Recovery of encryption keys from memory using a linear scan. In 2008 Third International Conference on Availability, Reliability and Security (pp. 1369-1376). IEEE.
Hargreaves & Chivers 2008b. Avoiding Live Imaging of Large Encrypted Volumes by Recovering Keys from Memory, Proceedings from 3rd Advances in Computer Security and Forensics

Halderman, J.A., Schoen, S.D., Heninger, N., Clarkson, W., Paul, W., Calandrino, J.A., Feldman, A.J., Appelbaum, J. and Felten, E.W., 2009. Lest we remember: cold-boot attacks on encryption keys. Communications of the ACM, 52(5), pp.91-98.
